intro: Corynocarpus australasicus, commonly known as the New Zealand kōwhai, is a deciduous tree native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grey-barked trunk and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The tree produces yellow flowers in clusters, followed by woody, spherical fruits that contain several seeds. It is adapted to temperate climates and is often found in coastal and lowland forests. The species plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various native wildlife.
